author: big_tech_sux
content: i just realized that since EOF code must originally come from txdata it does not need to be stored in the state database. like you can look it up from transaction history somehow. (data sections need to be stored in state though)

author: big_tech_sux
content: i think this can make pricing come way down, and also gives some optimization opportunities for clients (like they don't need to store physical code, just pointer to container from some transaction data)
